page.title: 02Illston - People's Lives
page.content: The majority of the workforce in the village now have to travel outside of Illston for employment. Many commute to Leicester. There are a substantial number of retired people living in the village. The village has no shop at all. Mobile tradesmen in vans call once a week i.e. butcher, greengrocer, fish and chip vendor and baker. Due to the lack of shops a large number of resid- ents own freezers to keep a supply of food. Many grow their own vegetables. Milk is delivered every other day to the customer's doorstep. Most people have a television set. Morning newspapers are not delivered but the Leicester Mercury, an evening paper is delivered Monday to Saturday and Sunday papers are brought from Kibworth.School children are collected and returned by bus daily.
